column4: running 8.04 now. Is there an advantage to running 9.10. If so, how do I upgrade?
yes and no
you can directly upgrade to 10.04, but not 9.10
also you won't get Ext4 file system or Grub 2 on upgrade, but you don't need those
8.04 is better than 10.04 in certain ways, it really is
sebsebseb:ok up to 10.04, is there an easy pathway? I'm new to ubuntu
how new?
like 4 months
ok if your that new, why  did you start on 8.04?
that's what downloaded of the cd I have.
ok, but four months ago,  the Ubuntu website would give the option.  to download 8.04 or 9.10

most new users would have gone with 9.10, however nevermind,  it's ok that you went with 8.04,  since as a result you have been using one of the best versions of Ubuntu,  and no 9.10 isn't one of those.
why do you want to upgrade now?  Newer is not always better.
and 8.04 runs out of support end of April next year on the desktop no more security updates.  and  10.10 comes out on October 10th 2010,  I have a feeling that will be a pretty good release
from what I know about it
thanks. I guess my issue is that i'm using gedit to write html code, and it won't allow any font face changes. size, yeah, but sometimes size doesn't matter.
might be a good idea to first try 10.04 in a virtual machine, if your computer can handle that so enough RAM for example, then decide if your going to upgrade to 10.04 or not.
loads of programs you can  use instead  for HTML code in Ubuntu
!html | lordship
!gedit | lordship
plus loads of programs that you can code HTML in on Windows, will work well in Wine
sebsebseb/ubottu: thanks, I'll go play for a while and see what works.
!thanks | lordship
you don't need to thank the bot, she is a computer program not a person
